intro: Thlaspi pindicum, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Thlaspi pindicum is often found in high-altitude areas where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions.
